Checks text using a customizable term list.


How to Check Text

  1. Open the page you want to check in Figma, FigJam, or Figma Slides.
  2. Launch the plugin and click the ‚ÄúCheck this page‚Äù button.
  3. The check results will be displayed, showing a list of text layers containing deprecated terms.
  4. Clicking on a flagged term will automatically focus on the corresponding text layer in the Figma page.


How to Update the Terms List

  1. If you want to update the terms list, expand the ‚ÄúUpdate Terms‚Äù section.
  2. Click the ‚ÄúImport CSV‚Äù button and select a CSV file containing the updated terms list.
  3. The CSV file should include the following columns:
  4. recommended: Preferred terms
  5. deprecated: Terms to avoid
  6. message: Explanation or corrective action
  7. url: Reference link (optional)
  8. Once the import is successful, the file name and date will be updated.

plugins.name: Pictoria
plugins.description:
Unlock Your Creative Potential with Our Figma Plugin!

Transform Your Designs with GIFs, Images, and AI!


Elevate your design process with our all-in-one Figma plugin that seamlessly integrates Giphy, Unsplash, and OpenAI. Whether you're a UI/UX designer, marketer, or creative professional, this plugin is your go-to tool for adding dynamic visuals and intelligent content to your projects.


‚ú® Key Features:


Search GIFs from Giphy: Quickly find and insert animated GIFs that perfectly match your design's tone and message. Simply type in a keyword, browse through a diverse selection, and bring your projects to life with eye-catching animations.


Access Stunning Images from Unsplash: Effortlessly search for high-quality, royalty-free images to complement your designs. With a vast library at your fingertips, you can find the perfect backdrop, illustration, or visual asset to enhance your creative work.


AI-Powered Content Suggestions from OpenAI: Harness the power of AI to generate descriptive text, taglines, or creative ideas directly within your Figma project. Just provide a prompt, and let OpenAI assist you in brainstorming and refining your design concepts.


‚ö° How to Use

Search for GIFs or Images:


  1. Enter your keyword in the search bar.
  2. Browse the results and click on the one you love.
  3. Voila! It‚Äôs in your Figma design!


Generate AI Images:


  1. Use the AI image generator by providing a creative description.
  2. Watch as AI generates a unique visual based on your input.
  3. Add it directly to your Figma canvas and start designing!


üåü Benefits of Using Our Plugin:


Boost Engagement: Add dynamic GIFs and captivating visuals that draw attention and keep users engaged.

Streamline Your Workflow: Access GIFs, images, and AI-generated content all in one place, saving you time and keeping you focused on your design work.

Inspire Creativity: Explore a variety of GIFs and images that spark new ideas and help you think outside the box.

User-Friendly Interface: Designed for ease of use, our plugin is perfect for designers of all skill levels.


üöÄ Get Started Today! Transform your design workflow with the ultimate creative toolkit. Install our Figma plugin and unlock a world of GIFs, stunning images, and AI-powered suggestions that will take your projects to the next level.
plugins.tagline: Figma plugin that allows users to enhance their design project by easily searching.

plugins.name: Style Manager for Tableau
plugins.description:
Import your Tableau Preferences.tps file to manage your colour palettes visually rather than editing XML.


  1. Merge Preference files
  2. Add palettes from hex codes
  3. Edit palettes
  4. Reorganise palettes
  5. Add standard palettes like viridis and turbo with the click of a button
  6. Add the palettes to your Figma design to make sure the colours align
  7. Automatically create Figma colour variables


Once you are done, export the Preferences.tps file to bring it back into Tableau.
plugins.tagline: Manage your Tableau Colour Palettes and import them into your Figma design files

plugins.name: Lucide Icons Importer from GitHub
plugins.description:
This plugin allows the user to import always the latest release of Lucide Icons directly from the official Lucide GitHub Repository.


Few steps for the best Lucide Icons experience:


  1. ‚¨Ü - Available Folders to analize the Lucide repo and obtain only the folders where svg files are in.
  2. üóÇÔ∏è - Select the folder to import. I suggest "/icons" to get the main icons library.
  3. ëøø - Select the Icon Name Option between original name or with prefix.
  4. üéõÔ∏è - Set Icon Size, Stroke Width, Color and, if you want test it through the WCAG Contrast Checker.
  5. ü™Ñ - Import the SVGs and wait for the magic.


Most important info:

  1. If you do your second icon import, the plugin will not replace your current library but will only check for differences and integrate the new icons. This way your projects will always be safe from unpleasant surprises ;)
  2. If the icon configuration is different from the one already present in your figma project, a new frame will be created to not overwrite other configurations.



* Let me know your feedback or bugfix requests. *
plugins.tagline: Import always the latest version of Lucide Icons

plugins.name: Decision Trackr
plugins.description:
No more meetings to debate decisions that have been made already.


Decision Trackr is a plugin that helps design teams capture, document, and review critical design decisions directly within their Figma projects. Select an element, log a decision and maintain a chronological version history of decisions made per element.


How to use it:

  1. Select the element to attach to your decision.
  2. Enter the decision and a reason.
  3. Add decision makers.
  4. Log your decision! üöÄ


A decision history page is created and all decisions are properly versioned and link directly to the element relating to the decision.


Key Features:


Link Decisions to Elements: Decision Trackr lets users attach design decisions directly to elements within a Figma file. This makes it easy to understand the rationale behind each design component and offers context to anyone viewing the file.


Decision History and Versioning: Each decision can be updated and versioned, providing a chronological record of changes and their respective contexts. This historical view is invaluable for teams who may revisit past iterations or need to understand how and why certain design choices were made.


Decision ownership: Tag each decision with attendees or decision-maker's names. Each name is recorded and assigned to a decision. When ownership of a decision is clear, design jams become a place for robust and productive debate.


This plugin is a must-have for teams who like to own their work, make clear decisions and talk about the right things in meetings. No more meetings to debate decisions that have been made already.
plugins.tagline: Quickly log, review, and manage design decisions within your Figma files.

plugins.name: Component Instance Looper
plugins.description:
Generate and populate component instances with text at scale.


By accepting a string of text separated by line breaks, the plugin creates instances of the selected component.


This is suitable if you have many component instances to create or edit, and you don't want to go one-by-one editing each individually.


You can also replace text in selected instances and specify which variable you wish to replace.


This workflow reduces context switching and dramatically speeds up efficiency for designers while adding content to their components instances.


-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-


By Connor

Contribute, raise an issue, or buy my a coffee.

plugins.name: design-tokens.io Figma Plugin
plugins.description:
This is the Figma plugin for design-tokens.io


design-tokens.io is the real-time hub for your Design Tokens.


Ensure design consistency across multiple brands, themes and projects.

Accelerate release cycles through seamless handoffs between designers and developers.

Built for agencies and enterprise design teams.


Consistency across all brands

Keep a single source of truth for all your Design Tokens. All your themes stay 100% interchangable, by default.


Seamless import & export

Import and export your Design Tokens as W3C-compliant JSON. Avoid vendor lock-in.


Real-time collaboration

Multiple users manage Design Tokens, themes and brands at the same time. No workflow bottlenecks, no data conflicts.


Bridge design and development

Designers sync their Design Tokens with Figma variables in real-time. Developers receive CSS/SASS variables. No manual handoffs necessary.



FAQs


What if I already use Figma Variables?

That‚Äôs fine! Our platform natively supports Figma Variables while protecting you from their limited scalability and interoperability. It acts as a single-source-of-truth for all your Design Tokens and integrates with all your tools, not just Figma.


I only use the free Figma plan. Will this work for me?

Yes! Our Figma plugin works with every Figma plan, even the free one. It lets you import your Design Tokens into Figma and sync your changes in real-time, no matter how many tokens, themes and brands you manage.


Why not use Tokens Studio?

Tokens Studio is great, but it is primarily a Figma plugin - intended to be used by Figma users from within Figma. It even stores all your Design Tokens inside Figma.

Our platform takes the opposite approach: It is a standalone, single-purpose data hub that lets your whole team collaborate on your Design Tokens and syncs them to all your tools, not just Figma.


We're already using Supernova. Is this compatible?

Absolutely! You can start using our platform in tandem with Supernova today, since Supernova will import your Design Tokens from Figma as usual. We're also working on a native Supernova hook that will make the process even more seamless!


Is the platform W3C-compliant?

Yes! Our platform ensures maximum interoperability with all your other tools by being fully compliant with the latest version of the W3C Design Tokens specification. You can seamlessly import and export Design Tokens as W3C DTCG JSON.


What's the learning curve for my team?

Our platform is reportedly much easier to use than comparable tools and was designed from the ground up to make managing and accessing Design Tokens as simple as possible.

You will be up and running in a matter of minutes. Watch demo
plugins.tagline: Auto-sync your Design Tokens from design-tokens.io to Figma

plugins.name: Variables export to Gitlab
plugins.description:
Figma Variables Export Plugin Instruction


The Figma Variables plugin was developed to convert Figma Variables into SASS variables. 

To use this plugin you should have some Local variables in your Figma project


The plugin has 2 features:

  1. Export file with SASS variables in .scss format
  2. Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request


Export file with SASS variables in .scss format

For exporting Figma Local Variables as SASS variables you just need to click the Export button


By clicking on the ‚ÄòExport‚Äô button the file with .scss extension will be created. It will contain all Figma local variables in SASS format.


This file can be used in the UI project that uses SASS variables. After any changes in Figma Local Variables all is needed is just to make export of variables into the project directory again and the state of Local Variables will be synchronized with the state of SASS variables in the UI project.


Publish file with SASS variables into Gitlab and create a merge request

This feature is more advanced. It suggests that SASS variables are placed in some file that is stored in a Gitlab repository. For using this feature we need to set our Gitlab settings:


  1. Gitlab Domain (gitlab.com or another)
  2. Gitlab Token (user can get it from Gitlab settings)
  3. Target branch where you should create a merge request with changes
  4. Path to file with variables (i.e. src/variables.scss)
  5. Project Id (user can see it on gitlab project's page)


By clicking on Publish button the plugin performs the next steps:

  1. Creates new branch for updates
  2. Editing the .scss file from the File Path input
  3. Creates a merge request with changes in this file from just created branch into the Target Branch


After that a person who has permissions of merging can open Gitlab, check changes and merge them.


This feature makes UI project synchronization with Figma mockups more seamless and stable. After making any changes in Figma variables, UX Designer needs only click the Publish button, and UI developer needs only check these changes in Gitlab and click Merge Changes button.
plugins.tagline: Export Figma variables to .scss file of push them to file in Gitlab repository

networkAccess.reasoning: Should support publish to any git repository

plugins.name: Asterisk
plugins.description:
Annotate your designs with Asterisk!


Creating annotations

  1. Annotate to the left, right, above or below a target
  2. Add an optional header
  3. Add optional notes (Shift+Enter to add multiple lines)
  4. Add smaller secondary notes and an optional URL
  5. Customize the spacing between an annotation and its target
  6. Choose the color of an annotation


Global controls

  1. Show/hide all annotations on a page
  2. Lock/unlock all annotations on a page
  3. Delete all annotations on a page
  4. Refresh annotation locations (useful if a component instance inherits changes and moves)


Quality of life features

  1. Annotations follow their targets*
  2. Move an existing annotation to a new target
  3. Change any property of a selected annotation even after it was created
  4. Press Enter after typing in an input to quickly create an annotation
  5. Collapse the UI so you can keep it open but out of the way
  6. Double click any color in the UI to change Asterisk's theme!
  7. Dark mode support


Annotation tuning

  1. Customize annotation max width
  2. Change text size
  3. Show / hide author names on annotations
  4. Apply your tunings to all annotations on a page at once


* Asterisk must be open for annotations to follow their targets
plugins.tagline: Annotations everyone can see

plugins.name: Reset Corner Radius
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to reset all rounded corners to 0 in the selected layers with a single click. It works not only on individual layers but also within groups and components, ensuring that any nested layers with rounded corners are also reset.

  1. Select a layer or frame.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. All rounded corners in the selected layer and its nested layers will be reset to 0.

plugins.name: Color cleaner: Merge similar colors & connect with variables
plugins.description:
About

Color Cleaner is a plugin designed to help streamline your Figma files not only by reducing the number of colors and minimizing subtle variations of the same shade, but also connecting them with variables.


How to use

Use the ‚ÄúLevel of cleanup‚Äù slider to adjust how much cleanup is applied. Preview the changes in the box below and choose a setting that balances effectiveness. Typically, aim for a setting that is neither too soft to make a noticeable difference, nor too hard to avoid merging distinct colors.

Toggle the ‚ÄúMatch with variables‚Äù checkbox if you want colors to be connected with available variables. When ready, click ‚ÄúClean.‚Äù After a brief moment, the changes will be applied to the selected element.

accepted.name: Ruslan Maslenkou

plugins.tagline: Merge similar color shades together and connect with variables in 1 click

plugins.name: Pinwheel Plugin
plugins.description:
Import Design Tokens JSON to Figma variables and Figma styles. Export Figma variables and styles to Design Tokens JSON. Use mode names to create groups for light mode, dark mode, and high contrast variants. Full support for importing and exporting sRGB and Display P3, allowing colors to maintain correct appearance when being moved from Figma to Pinwheel.


It‚Äôs a great way to transfer colors, numbers, strings, shadows, and booleans to and from Figma to Pinwheel, or anywhere that can import Design Tokens Community Group formatted JSON.


What's Pinwheel? We‚Äôre glad you asked. It‚Äôs an amazing app for managing your design system, converting between color formats and color spaces, and automating color contrast testing. If you work with design systems, Pinwheel is for you.

plugins.name: Bezier Palette Studio
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with this intuitive color palette generator that creates harmonious and accessible color scales. Using advanced HSV color mapping and B√©zier curves, this plugin helps you generate professional color palettes.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Palette Generation
  2. Auto Naming: Generate intuitive color names automatically based on hue values, ensuring consistency and saving time.
  3. Customizable Steps: Choose the exact number of shades per swatch to suit your project needs.
  4. Powerful B√©zier Curve Control
  5. Interactive Curve Editor: Adjust color transitions using an intuitive B√©zier curve interface integrated with an HSV color picker for unprecedented accuracy.
  6. Predefined and Customizable Curves: Pick from pre-made curves or switch to free-hand mode for full creative freedom.
  7. Accessibility
  8. Contrast Ratio Analysis: Automatically assess each color's contrast ratio against black and white backgrounds to ensure accessibility compliance.
  9. Color Tokens: Assign unique identifiers to every shade for hassle-free referencing across your designs.
  10. Seamless Integration and Export
  11. Export Color Tokens: Export your palette as JSON tokens for integration into your design systems or development workflows.
  12. Figma Frame Export: Instantly export palettes as organized frames within the current page of your Figma file for easy sharing and collaboration.
  13. Style Creation: Create reusable styles directly in your Figma file with one click, streamlining your workflow.


This plugin is perfect for design systems, brand guidelines, or any project requiring consistent color scales. It streamlines the color creation process while ensuring your palettes meet professional quality standards.

Elevate your design process with an intelligent color generation that combines creative freedom with technical precision.

plugins.name: AppStore Screenshot Icon Hunter
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin for automatically retrieving and laying out App Store app screenshots.


Key Features

‚Ä¢Support searching for apps by name or App ID

‚Ä¢Automatically fetch high-resolution app screenshots

‚Ä¢Support multiple data sources (App Store API, iTunes Search API)

‚Ä¢Automatically create beautiful layouts

‚Ä¢Display download progress in real time

‚Ä¢Support customizing icon sizes and spacing


Usage

1.Install the plugin in Figma

2.Search for the app by name or App ID

3.Select the target app

4.Configure layout parameters (optional)

5.Click the ‚ÄúCollect & Package‚Äù button

6.Wait for screenshot download and layout completion
plugins.tagline: Automatically fetch high-resolution app screenshots&icon

plugins.name: Grid Exterminator
plugins.description: Grid Exterminator is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the design process by allowing users to remove grids in three ways: from selected items, from the current page, or from all pages in the archive. This tool is particularly useful for designers who frequently use grids to structure their layouts but need to quickly clean up their workspace for presentations, final touches, or when grids are no longer needed. Grid Exterminator enhances efficiency by simplifying the grid removal process, ensuring a cleaner and more organized design environment.
